meanings.definition: A shout of approval or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: The crowd let out a loud oles when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: He received many oles from the audience after his speech.
meanings.sent3: The oles from the fans motivated the players to give their best.
meanings.sent4: Her oles of encouragement echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The oles of the crowd filled the air with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The flamenco dancers performed graceful oles during the show.
meanings.sent2: She learned the oles as part of her dance class.
meanings.sent3: The oles at the fiesta were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The oles of the dancers painted a vibrant picture on stage.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic oles captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: A type of oil used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a tablespoon of oles for frying.
meanings.sent2: She preferred using oles for salad dressings.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of the oles filled the kitchen as she cooked.
meanings.sent4: The golden hue of the oles added richness to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the oles in the pan signaled dinner was almost ready.
